alert.note: Alert for Barnes (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 2:53PM CST until February 20 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Barnes County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to 6 PM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
